description: I've actaully given up playing Minecraft in favour of Vintage Story now. This game has so much content and far superior survival mechanics. Every day you survive is a blessing, every crop harvest, a relief and every advancement; a satisfying experience. I highly recommend this game. It's made by an independent developer.
summary: Probably the best Minecraft-Inspired survival game yet!

description:
I'm glad to have found this flatpak, as the original file requires .NET 7.0, which is now EOL and therefore not supplied by every distro anymore, making the installation a real pain.
Works OOTB.
There seems to be an issue with some system upgrades however, as the executable will just quit with an error after a system upgrade.
However a reinstallation seems to fix that issue.

You can only play it if you've already purchased it and it cost $15 which is ludicrous. Plenty of GOG Linux games for a $2-3 Usd far superior than this minecraft clone. Linux is free OS and should not have or market any paid software. If you want to sell your sh*t go to f*ing steam!
summary: This is not a free game - this is a paid game!

description: nnnnnnnnopeeeeeeeeeeeee
Hate this garbage

Saw this on gnome software and wondered what it was, saw the petulant reviews, dismissed the whining that a developer dared to make a game in the same genre as another game, or that they dared to charge a fee for their hard work and dedication.  

Go look at the trailer. Wow! I

This is an indie game sold direct, it cost me £10.71, that's like 8 beers. Its nothing. I'm already totally hooked. Much more depth than MC, more tension, surviving one night feels like a genuine achievement. There is so much more to learn. Can't wait to discover more. Works flawlessly on Fedora and Tumbleweed
Works like Windows, and runs well at the time of writing.

I played this game a bit at a friend's house and it's a fun game. Thought it was a Minecraft clone at first but it's still a good time killer.
Please ignore all the reviews, they're mostly children who don't develop and think everyone wants to take time from their lives to provide software and games to them for free.

So many people seem to look at the 1m³ cubes and decide that this is a simple Minecraft clone, which is really not the case.

Vintage Story is a tough survival game with a bunch of realistic crafting methods, priced well for the sheer amount of content it comes with, and the entire game has been built from the ground up with modding in mind as well.
should not be on the gnome software center.
well i thought it was a free game
summary: You need to buy the Account to Play

description: Get this off.

Like Minecraft, it's a voxel based game, but has more detailed customization and is focused more on survival. You will die... a lot. 

Flatpak works great, actually think it's easy to get started using that compared to Windows.
We enjoy free software, not paywalls. This title won't be up for very long. Anyone looking for a free multi-player voxel on Flathub check out Veloren.

It costs about $18 to purchase an account, which I think is respectable for a game of this quality. The game is fairly difficult and a bit tedious at times, but that makes it a much different experience from other sandbox games currently available. I'd recommend checking out some youtube reviews to see if it's the type of game you'd enjoy. Only real problem I've had with it so far is the occaisonal lag spike, but the majority of the time the game runs fine.
summary: Good sandbox game with a strong focus on realism

description: This is not a free product and requires a paid license, but this package makes installation of it much easier. Works without issues. Thank you very much for maintaining it!
summary: Easy install for a great game

description:
For starters, The game costs 18.00 Euros. Im not against having to pay an indie developer for a game, but considering the lack of originality here, I'll admit, 18 Euros is pretty steep for most people (myself included).
The UI in the game is bland. The clouds (while stylistic) feel out of place and lack the same level of detail the rest of the game tries to uphold.
The combat is not fun, Its just a copy/paste of Minecrafts old combat system (Minecraft is by no means a golden standard). It's dull, spammy, stilted, and just plain boring.
Otherwise, the gameplay is solid, the overall presentation of the graphics are pretty good. The character design looks... Interesting...
That being said, the game is highly customizable with mods from the developers main website, so you can always count on others to make the experience a little more fun.
mogs minecraft
If you want the real survival experience, this is your game. Like Minecraft but more challenging. And now flatpack! Must buy if you own a Steam Deck

Yes, this game is not free. It's very affordable though. Having it as flatpak on the SteamDeck is very convenient! 

It may seem like a Minecraft 'ripoff' at first glance, but it differs greatly in mechanics, atmosphere and the overall goal of the game. While minecraft is a happy building-blocks-sandbox, Vintage Story is about survival and a higher degree of realism. Don't let the looks of it fool you.

The game is in active development by wonderful devs, who fully deserve every penny of the asking price.
Work in steamdeck really nice but better play with mouse

This review comes from the perspective of a yearlong fan but also an active Moderator for one of the many server/communities in VS.

The time spent playing this game has easily clocked triple digits - yet the full scope of all the mechanics available has yet to be experienced. This scope does include mods as the typical server (exception : Mudwall) is continuously evolving with different mod combinations. The possible game styles available are seemingly limitless and the integration with normal game-play is nothing short of seamless. All this amazing madding potential under-shadows the level of depth, engagement, and subtle complexity that already holds the base game up as a fully satisfying standalone title.(returning example : Mudwall Server)

This doesn't go without a personal regret. The amount of time I'd spent this year - playing this game - pushed my almost gaming addiction into a real world problem. This problem was enough to force me to take a serious look at what (little) benefit most games gave - and whether the cost to my life was worth it. In the end almost all games were cut and the few that remained on the short list were because of community. VS, is the only game that offered something more than just a friend group however and now sits as the only game that is welcome on my daily ToDo.

As expected with communities and the ability to engage - there's a place for every kind of player out there. The excitement of combat and adventure, the satisfaction from meaningful progression, the engaging nature of role play, and the unrivalled creative potential that building mechanics have to offer in this game. These are but a few core gameplay avenues that players can have access too when playing. Different servers will have tailored experiences suited to serve on play style or another. My personal server is with a growing role-play community called MoonDrop. Come visit sometime.

This community in mind - the great reward that VS brings to the table is the strong creative collaboration between players, servers, modders, and *especially* the developers themselves. The potential for this game is through the roof and so is the ease of learning for any budding developers wanting to try their hand at it. So much is being unlocked on the back of this fantastic and robust engine that at times it's hard to even keep up. Best of all - this game is still thick with unrealised future features and - stable as it is - is still quite aways from finishing(if it ever will). On top of this - Tyron and his lovely crew are pushing out big updates that make the worlds most popular voxel game developers seem irredeemably incompetent.

To all those stubborn people saying "Free or go home" - just stop. You might not realise the damage you are doing to linux, and open-source adoption in general.

Best Minecraft alternative these days. Has active community, servers and is just a breath of fresh air. It's not owned by Microsoft, so even though it's not fully open source it feels much more free. Maybe like Minecraft when it came out, but I haven't played it back than so can't be sure.

I know that Minetest exists, but it just isn't a polished game and has hardcoded limitations like the world size.

Disclaimer: The account you need to play the game is paid for. Don't download this game thinking it's free!

Great survival game, works excellently with friends. Defenitely has some minecraft vibes, but offers a completely unique experience through a more survival focused gameplay, unique crafting mechanics and some sprinkles of lovecraftian creatures. Works flawlessly on steam deck, and the multiplayer is very smooth even when relying on hamachi.

It has similarities to minecraft, but it's more about survival. Hunger is a significant threat, winter is coming and crop rotation matters. Getting metal is a trial but each upgrade feels like a big leap foreward. Crafting is generally more involved but there's an extensive in-game handbook. There's a robust modding scene too. It's good if you're into historic or primitive technology

No 1.18?
jargon needed to push the review
Are you seriously requiring an account to play? So i guess you think you are some big shot developer or company right? Wrong broski hard pass!
summary: requires a login for a game this bad?

description: didn't expect that

Despite looking like Minecraft, which I blame entirely on us all having grown so stale in the blocky survival theme that we must think everything in the genre must be a Minecraft ripoff, this game is amazing.

Development is a bit slow due to the small team, but the mods make it all the better. It's an entirely different game than what you might compare it with, sporting better combat, better survival mechanics, and a lot of fun to be had.

Love playing this sandbox for all types of things, the level of customizability is insane.
Requires an account costing $23 at current writing. This does not belong in the free software repos.

I'm just annoyed by all the reviews complaining that an account costs money. In an ideal world all games would be free, but we don't live in that world.
IMO this game is better than Minecraft (which also costs $$$) without mods, runs cleaner, more beautiful and varied landscapes, and has some really neat early game mechanics like flint knapping, smithing, and animal domestication. It feels like living in a medieval, vintage world.
Watch out for the wolves and bears.

The flatpak version of this game is completely broken. The game randomly crashes in menus and no matter how hard you try you cannot close the app (used alt F4 and the system monitor and neither worked) also the issue where the mouse works completely fine in menus but in the game you just can't look around. Putting a paid game up for free as a flatpak is definitely weird but the account system isn't half bad. This game looks super fun I just wish it wasn't so hard to play on Linux.
Its not working for me idk why. It looks really promising, i just cant play it.
I had some problems at first but now it runs ok on steam deck, still mouse and keyboard is nessesry for me tho
Works well on Deck, just need to set up controls. Trackpads help a lot.
Very stable and gameplay of highest rating
Hurdurr not free
It is a good survival game. Very realistic.

It's basically TerraFirmaCraft, or rather its TerraFirmaPunk modpack, but as a standalone title. Everyone who played TFC will immediately feel right at home, with many features, mechanics and design principles being almost 1 to 1 taken from TFC, while also putting its own spin on the whole genre.
For everyone else who want to maybe have a more mature Minecraft, like a Minecraft for adults, would also be in the right place with Vintage Story.

Flathub updates could be faster though...
Yes, flathub also host's non-free software. Maybe you should read the description before downloading something. Even on linux. 🤔
Would love a flatpack update to 1.19.7!

With everything that is implemented, the developers seem to go the extra mile. A few things feel unpolished like the clouds or the screen shake when walking, but this stuff ultimately comes down to preference
es muy bueno pa
NOMAMES QUE CHIDO
NUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUL

It's Minecraft but more engaging and made by developers who doesn't hate their playerbase.

Great on the Steam Deck too!
summary: Virgin Minecraft vs Chad Vintage Story

description: BUT WHERE'S THE 1.19 UPDATE??? STILL WAITING DAMMIT!
Зарегистрировался на портале. В игру с этим логином не пускает.

В центре приложений это одна из тех игр что поставляется бесплатно, да вот только сама игра платная. Для регистраций вам нужно купить ключ, который стоит приличную сумму денег. Отдавать за игру почти 20 евро как-то слишком много. Не могу ничего сказать о самой программе — поиграть так и не удалось.

Серьёзно, намного интереснее, чем оригинал. Хотя её уже давно надо называть другой игрой, тк от Minecraft здесь осталась только система блоков и то переработанная. 
Например, можно делить блок на микроблоки и делать скульптуры с украшениями и переставлять их, костры здесь можно найти по дыму. Механика инструментов и рецептов совершенно другая. Мобы ведут себя иначе, нет ни одного похожего. Это не фентези, скорее суровое выживание, где важна температура и заготовки, тк зима близко и она наступает везде, а там голод не тётка.
Свои моды, своя атмосфера - всего не перечислишь.

Изначально может показаться, что эта игра очередной клон одной не малоизвестной игры. Но со временем понимаешь, что кроме кубов сходства и нет. 
Упор идёт на реализм, где-то это уже будет надоедать, но общие впечатление не изменятся. 
Те кто любят проектировать и делать сложную архитектуру будут радоваться до потери пульса. Многие блоки можно (специальным инструментом) вырезать и получать воистину захватывающее зрелище. 
Игру нужно купить на официальном сайте игры, она не бесплатна.
summary: Хорошая игра (Игру нужно купить на официальном сайте игры)

description: When will 1.18 be released on flathub?
Да, это платная игра, но разве это плохо, что в Flathub наконец-то начали появляться и платные приложения? Как по мне - это победа
